newsitem.title: COMOROS: Comoro Islands mourns for Deng for two days.
newsitem.headline: Comoro Islands mourns for Deng for two days.

text.p: The tiny Indian Ocean island archipelago of Comoros is observing two days of national mourning with flags at half mast to mark the death of China's paramount leader Deng Xiaoping.

"The deep pain the Chinese people are enduring on the death of this unforgettable builder of modern China is unquestionably ours," state radio quoted Territory Development Minister and Government Spokesman Mouzaoir Abdallah as saying on Thursdday.

China and Comoros have had close relations since the islands became independent from France in 1975. President Mohamed Taki visited China in December and Beijing agreed to build more government offices and a state television building in Comoros.
